summary: DOD remains unable to receive a clean audit opinion on its financial statements, partly due to inaccurate records for its 573,000 real property assets and 26 million acres of land. Better data could help the government identify unneeded buildings, reduce costs, and potentially save millions of dollars. DOD has not yet developed a department-wide strategy to address this issue. Instead, each military service is independently...
title: Defense Real Property: DOD-Wide Strategy Needed to Address Control Issues and Improve Reliability of Records
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
